researchSources: Florida Statutes Chapter 537 - Title Loan Act

legalStatus.loanTypeAllowed: Title Loans (Regulated under Ch. 537 and Ch. 516)
legalStatus.restrictions: Must be licensed by Florida Office of Financial Regulation; Subject to strict interest rate caps and consumer protection requirements
legalStatus.notes: Florida has two regulatory frameworks: Chapter 537 (Title Loan Act) provides stronger consumer protections. Chapter 516 (Consumer Finance) applies to larger loans.

regulations.maxAPR: 30% per annum on first $2,000; 24% per annum on $2,000-$3,000; 18% per annum over $3,000
regulations.rolloverLimit: No limit but interest cannot exceed original rate

fees.otherFees: All fees must be disclosed in writing

licensing.licenseType: Title Loan Lender License (Ch. 537) or Consumer Finance License (Ch. 516)

requiredDisclosures: Total cost of loan in dollars and APR
prohibitedPractices: Charging more than statutory interest rate caps

collectionRules.saleNotice: 10 days advance written notice before sale
collectionRules.rightToReclaim: Yes, before sale by paying balance plus costs

recentChanges.change: Continued enforcement of tiered APR caps under Florida Title Loan Act

cityPageContent.headline: Understanding Title Loan Laws in Florida
cityPageContent.intro: Residents of {{city}} are protected by Florida's Title Loan Act (Chapter 537) and Consumer Finance regulations enforced by the Office of Financial Regulation.
keyPoints: 30% APR cap on first $2,000 of loan amount
All lenders must be licensed by FL OFR
Written loan agreement required by law
10 days written notice required before vehicle sale
Surplus from sale must be returned within 30 days
cityPageContent.disclaimer: This information is for general educational purposes only and may not reflect the most current legal developments. Laws and regulations change frequently. Always consult with a licensed attorney or contact the Florida Office of Financial Regulation at (850) 487-9687 or visit www.flofr.gov for the most accurate and up-to-date information before making any financial decisions.
